desc_content.paragraph: Return the list of every mapping type available.

list_item.paragraph: service_id (uuid) – UUID of the service to filter on.
service_data (Service) – Informations about the service to create.

desc_content.paragraph: Delete the service and all the sub keys recursively.

list_item.paragraph: service_id (uuid) – UUID of the service to delete.

desc_content.paragraph: A service is directly mapped to the usage key, the collected service.
Type describing a list of services.

list_item.paragraph: service_id (uuid) – Service’s UUID to filter on.
field_id (uuid) – UUID of the field to filter on.
field_data (Field) – Informations about the field to create.

desc_content.paragraph: Delete the field and all the sub keys recursively.

list_item.paragraph: field_id (uuid) – UUID of the field to delete.

desc_content.paragraph: A field is mapping a value of the ‘desc’ dict of the CloudKitty data. It’s used to map the name of a metadata.
Type describing a list of fields.

list_item.paragraph: service_id – Service UUID to filter on.
field_id – Field UUID to filter on.
group_id – Group UUID to filter on.
no_group – Filter on orphaned mappings.
tenant_id – Tenant UUID to filter on.
filter_tenant – Explicitly filter on tenant (default is to not

desc_content.paragraph: filter on tenant). Useful if you want to filter on tenant being None. :return: List of every mappings. :type service_id: uuid :type field_id: uuid :type group_id: uuid :type no_group: bool :type tenant_id: uuid :type filter_tenant: bool

list_item.paragraph: mapping_id (uuid) – UUID of the mapping to filter on.
mapping_data (Mapping) – Informations about the mapping to create.
mapping_id (uuid) – UUID of the mapping to update.
mapping (Mapping) – Mapping data to insert.
mapping_id (uuid) – UUID of the mapping to delete.

desc_content.paragraph: Get the group attached to the mapping.

list_item.paragraph: mapping_id (uuid) – UUID of the mapping to filter on.

desc_content.paragraph: A mapping is used to apply rating rules based on a value, if the parent is a field then it’s check the value of a metadata. If it’s a service then it directly apply the rate to the volume.
Type describing a list of mappings.

A threshold is used to apply rating rules based on a level, if the parent is a field then the level is checked against a metadata. If it’s a service then it’s the quantity of the resource that is checked.
Type describing a list of mappings.

list_item.paragraph: group_id (uuid) – UUID of the group to filter on.
group_data (Group) – Informations about the group to create.
group_id (uuid) – UUID of the group to delete.
recursive (bool) – Delete mappings recursively.

desc_content.paragraph: Get the mappings attached to the group.

list_item.paragraph: group_id (uuid) – UUID of the group to filter on.

desc_content.paragraph: Get the thresholds attached to the group.

list_item.paragraph: group_id (uuid) – UUID of the group to filter on.

desc_content.paragraph: A group is used to divide calculations. It can be used to create a group for the instance rating (flavor) and one if we have premium images (image_id). So you can take into account multiple parameters during the rating.
Type describing a list of groups.
